info.title: OPERA Cloud Content Service
info.description:
Opera Content Service offers capability to manage large content such as images and files.

Compatible with OPERA Cloud release 22.3.

This document and all content within is available under the Universal Permissive License v 1.0 (https://oss.oracle.com/licenses/upl). Copyright (c) 2020, 2023 Oracle and/or its affiliates.

get.description:
Use this API to get a customized letter.

OperationId:getCustomizedLetter

parameters.name: letterIdContext
parameters.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

parameters.name: letterIdtype
parameters.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

200.description: Response object for retrieving customized letter.

get.description:
Use this API to retrieve email Blob File Stored in File Storage Schema.Its used in Profiles to fetch Email and Open in an end user's mail client.

OperationId:getEmailFile

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: Unique OPERA Email ID which is used to find an Email BLOB File from OPERA. This ID is a primary identification of an email file in OPERA.

200.description: Response to fetch an email file

get.description:
This APU will fetch file attachments.

OperationId:getFileAttachment

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

parameters.name: idContext
parameters.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

parameters.name: idType
parameters.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

post.description:
Use this APU to upload a file attachment.

OperationId:uploadFileAttachment

parameters.name: fileToUpload
parameters.description: Request to upload a file attachment.

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

post.description:
Use this APU to email folio report.

OperationId:emailFolioReport

parameters.name: folioReportToEmail
parameters.description: Request to generate and email a folio report.

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

put.description:
You can set a customized letter with this API.

OperationId:setCustomizedLetter

parameters.name: customizedLetter
parameters.description: Request to save customized letter.

200.description: Existing Operations Responses will eventually be modified to be extended from this type.

get.description:
This API will get a folio report for a reservation.

OperationId:getFolioReport

parameters.name: reservationIdContext
parameters.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

parameters.name: reservationIdType
parameters.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

parameters.name: folioWindowNo
parameters.description: Folio window number to generate (defaults to view 1).

parameters.name: billNumber
parameters.description: Optional bill number to generate.

parameters.name: folioType
parameters.description: Optional folio type.

parameters.name: folioDate
parameters.description: Optional folio generation date - defaults to hotel business date.

parameters.name: referenceCurrency
parameters.description: Folio currency code.

get.description:
This API will get a registration card for a reservation.

OperationId:getRegistrationCard

parameters.name: reservationIdContext
parameters.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

parameters.name: reservationIdType
parameters.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

parameters.name: regenerate
parameters.description: Flag indicating whether a new registration card should be generated even if a signed card already exists.

parameters.name: signedOnly
parameters.description: Flag indicating whether return only the signed registrationCard if present.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Optional language code to use for registration card generation. Default guest language will be applied if not specified.

parameters.name: template
parameters.description: Optional registration card template code to use for registration card generation. Default template will be applied if not specified.

post.description:
You can use this API to upload an image.

OperationId:uploadImage

parameters.name: imageToUpload
parameters.description: Request to upload an image.

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

get.description:
You can use this API to get an image.

OperationId:getImage

parameters.name: linkId
parameters.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

parameters.name: linkIdContext
parameters.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

parameters.name: linkIdType
parameters.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

parameters.name: imageParameterValue
parameters.description: Image parameter value.

parameters.name: imageStyle
parameters.description: An enumeration of image styles.

parameters.name: imageId
parameters.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

parameters.name: imageIdContext
parameters.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

parameters.name: imageIdType
parameters.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

parameters.name: base64
parameters.description: True if the image to be returned as a base64String else if the image to be returned as the binary in MTOM attachment then false .

authKey.name: authorization
authKey.description: Bearer token that needs to be passed which is generated post user authentication

x-hotelid.name: x-hotelid
x-hotelid.description: Mandatory parameter to identify the hotel code where the end user is logged in

x-hubid.name: x-hubid
x-hubid.description: x-hubid is a logical grouping of multiple properties that allows api consumers to manage data from a group of properties. This x-hubid is a valid list of hub codes configured in OPERA to which the user has access. Rest APIs without hotelId in the operation path can support hub level integration using x-hubid

customizedLetter.description: Response object for retrieving customized letter.

customizedLetterDetails.description: Customized letter in HTML or RTF format.

hotelId.description: Hotel code that the customized letter belongs to.

reservationId.description: Reservation ID that the customized letter belongs to.

customizedLetter.description: Customized letter in HTML or RTF format.

url.description: URL that identifies the location associated with the record identified by the UniqueID.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

instance.description: The identification of a record as it exists at a point in time. An instance is used in update messages where the sender must assure the server that the update sent refers to the most recent modification level of the object being updated.

idContext.description: Used to identify the source of the identifier (e.g., IATA, ABTA).

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

idExtension.description: Additional identifying value assigned by the creating system.

uniqueID_Type.description: An identifier used to uniquely reference an object in a system (e.g. an airline reservation reference, customer profile reference, booking confirmation number, or a reference to a previous availability quote).

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

instanceLink.description: Metadata describing link description objects that MAY appear in the JSON instance representation.

href.description: URI [RFC3986] or URI Template [RFC6570]. If the value is set to URI Template, then the "templated" property must be set to true.

rel.description: Name of the link relation that, in addition to the type property, can be used to retrieve link details. For example, href or profile.

templated.description: Boolean flag that specifies that "href" property is a URI or URI Template. If the property is a URI template, set this value to true. By default, this value is false.

method.description: HTTP method for requesting the target of the link.

targetSchema.description: Link to the metadata of the resource, such as JSON-schema, that describes the resource expected when dereferencing the target resource..

operationId.description: The operationId of the path you can call to follow this link.  This allows you to look up not only the path and method, but the description of that path and any parameters you need to supply.

title.description: Exact copy of the "summary" field on the linked operation.

warningsType.description: Used in conjunction with the Success element to define a business error.

warningType.description: Used when a message has been successfully processed to report any warnings or business errors that occurred.

shortText.description: An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.

code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings.

docURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the ErrorRS, (NotProcessed Incomplete Complete Unknown) however, the data type is designated as string data, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

tag.description: If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

recordId.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

type.description: The Warning element MUST contain the Type attribute that uses a recommended set of values to indicate the warning type. The validating XSD can expect to accept values that it has NOT been explicitly coded for and process them by using Type ="Unknown".

rph.description: Reference Place Holder used as an index for this warning.

exceptionDetailType.title: Error Detail
exceptionDetailType.description: Complex type that contains error details for a REST call.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

o:errorPath.description: Path to the problem at the resource or property level.

o:errorDetails.description: Details of the error message, consisting of a hierarchical tree structure.

errorInstance.title: Error Instance Details
errorInstance.description: Complex type that contains error instance details for a REST call.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

o:errorPath.description: Path to the problem at the resource or property level.

emailFile.description: Response object for Fetch Email Blob File Operation.

file.description: Email File Blob Details based on email Id Number

emailFileType.description: ID that uniquely defines an email object

emailID.description: Unique ID that represents an email.

emailFile.description: File attachment in base64 binary format

fileAttachmentType.description: ID that uniquely determines file attachment

attachmentId.description: Unique ID that represents file attachment

fileAttachment.description: File attachment in base64 binary format

fileToUpload.description: Request to upload a file attachment.

userName.description: User (name) related to the attachment file.

hotelId.description: Resort related to the attachment file.

globalYN.description: Global Yes (Y) or No (N) flag related to the attachment file.

fileAttachment.description: Attachment file in base64 binary format.

overwriteExistingFileYN.description: Overwrite Yes (Y) or No (N) flag related to the attachment file.

stringLength200.description: Used for Character Strings, length 0 to 200.

stringLength1000.description: Used for Character Strings, length 0 to 1000.

stringLength2000.description: Used for Character Strings, length 0 to 2000.

stringLength10.description: Used for Character Strings, length 0 to 10.

status.description: Existing Operations Responses will eventually be modified to be extended from this type.

folioReportToEmail.description: Request to generate and email a folio report.

emailRecipients.description: List of email recipients for the report.

folioReportCriteriaType.description: Criteria required to generate or retrieve a folio for a reservation.

reservationId.description: Reservation ID to generate a folio for.

folioWindowNo.description: Folio window number to generate (defaults to view 1).

folioDate.description: Optional folio generation date - defaults to hotel business date.

customizedLetterStatus.description: Existing Operations Responses will eventually be modified to be extended from this type.

folioReportResultType.description: Folio card details, including PDF report.

registrationCardType.description: Registration card details, including PDF report.

hotelId.description: Hotel code for the registration card.

reservationId.description: Reservation ID identifying the reservation for the registration card.

images.description: Image upload details including image to upload.

imageUploadInfoType.description: List of Image details to upload including image to upload.

fileExtension.description: File extension of the Image, e.g. JPG, PNG, BMP, etc.

imageParameters.description: Zero or more image parameters - code / value pairs which define the image path. These are dependent on the image code type.

imageId.description: Image Id of the image to be replaced.

imageParametersType.description: Collection of image parameters code / value pairs.

imageSet.description: Image set describing path of image.

base64Image.description: Base64Image image content of the file.

tags.name: OperaContent
tags.description: Opera Content Service offers capability to manage big content using MTOM
